Package controller

Class ModifyPartForm

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyPartForm
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyPartForm extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is the controller for modifying parts in the Inventory Management System app.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the "Modify Part" page of the app. The parts table will be populated with the values of the part that was selected by the user.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • onCancelButton

      public void onCancelButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method will cancel the current actions on the page and return the the main Inventory Management System page. It will bring up a pop-up window to confirm whether to exit or not.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, the action of notifying the user and confirming cancellation from the "Modify Part Form" page.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onInHouse

      public void onInHouse(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method will convert the label in the "Modify Part Form" to "Machine ID" when the user clicks on the In-House radio button.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action of setting the text in the inHouseOrOutsourced text label.

    • onOutsourced

      public void onOutsourced(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method will convert the label in the "Modify Part Form" to "Company Name" when the user clicks on the In-House radio button.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action of setting the text in the inHouseOrOutsourced text label.

    • onSaveButton

      public void onSaveButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method takes all of the part input from the user and sets them in the corresponding variables. An error message will popup in the scenario that certain criteria are not met. These scenarios are: user not inputting integers for machine ID, inputting invalid values or leaving the fields blank, and not setting the proper stock values.
      Parameters:
      event - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, setting all the part variables and notifying the user if there are any improper inputs.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • minStock

      public boolean minStock(int min, int max)
      This method ensures that the inventory value set by the user is less than or equal to the maximum stock and greater than or equal to the minimum stock. If the value is out of these bounds, an error message is displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value of the inventory for the part.
      max - The maximum value of the inventory for the part.
      Returns:
      Returns the value of true to the validStock variable if the conditions of the method are met (inventory between min and max).

    • validInventory

      public boolean validInventory(int min, int max, int stock)
      This method ensures that the minimum value set for the part is greater than zero and less than the maximum value. If the value is out of these bounds, an error message is displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value of the inventory for the part.
      max - The maximum value of the inventory for the part.
      stock - The value of stock to check between min and max.
      Returns:
      Returns the value of true to the validInventory variable if the conditions of the method are met (min value greater than 0 and less than max value).
